description: Development and data generation scripts for testing and database population

components.main: Main function generating realistic sales data with 300 transactions for previous month.

components._generateCompatibleServices: Service combination generator ensuring category compatibility and realistic service bundling.

components._calculateRealisticDuration: Duration calculator with realistic time overruns and service time variations.

components._generateBusinessHourTime: Business hours time generator creating realistic appointment scheduling patterns.

components._weightedServiceCount: Weighted random service count selection favoring single services over multiple.

components._selectWeightedPaymentMethod: Payment method selection with realistic distribution (40% credit, 30% debit, 30% cash).

components._areIncompatibleCategories: Service category compatibility checker preventing conflicting service combinations.

rules: Generates 300 realistic ticket transactions for previous month with comprehensive service data.
Realistic service combinations based on nail salon service categories and compatibility rules.
Service compatibility logic prevents incompatible combinations (Gel vs Acrylic, SNS vs Gel/Acrylic).
Weighted service selection: 50% single service, 30% two services, 20% three services.
Business hours scheduling: 9 AM - 7 PM with peak hour weighting (10 AM-1 PM, 2 PM-4 PM).
Realistic duration calculations with tendency to run over: 70% within ±10%, 20% +10-30% over, 10% significantly over.
Payment method distribution reflecting real-world usage patterns.
Sample services include typical nail salon offerings: manicures, pedicures, acrylics, gel, nail art, eyebrow services.
Employee rotation with 4 sample technicians for realistic workload distribution.
Customer name rotation with 20 diverse sample names for realistic customer base.
SQL generation with proper INSERT statements for tickets and payments tables.
Transaction-based SQL output with BEGIN/COMMIT for data integrity.
Timestamp-based unique ID generation for tickets and payments.
Service JSON formatting with proper escaping for database storage.
Business date tracking aligned with check-in times for reporting accuracy.
Comprehensive ticket status management: all generated tickets marked as 'completed' and 'paid'.
Payment record creation matching ticket totals with realistic processing times.
File output generation creating executable SQL scripts for database population.
Summary reporting with transaction counts and date range information.
Error-resistant design with proper JSON escaping and SQL injection prevention.
15-minute appointment intervals reflecting typical salon scheduling practices.
Category-based service pricing with realistic price ranges for different service types.
Duration-based scheduling with realistic appointment time calculations.
Development utility designed for database testing and report validation purposes.

components.Service: Data class representing salon services with price, duration, and category information.

components.ServiceCategory: Data class representing service categories with incompatibility rules for realistic service combinations.

components.Employee: Data class representing technicians/employees for service assignment.

components.Customer: Data class representing customers from existing database records.

components.main: Main function generating 300 realistic transactions with advanced service compatibility and business logic.

components._generateCompatibleServices: Advanced service combination generator with category-based compatibility checking.

components._calculateRealisticDuration: Sophisticated duration calculator with realistic time distribution and service overruns.

components._generateBusinessHourTime: Business hours time generator with peak hour weighting for realistic scheduling.

components._weightedServiceCount: Weighted service count selection favoring realistic service combinations.

components._selectWeightedPaymentMethod: Payment method selection with realistic distribution patterns.

components._getIncompatibleCategories: Business logic defining service category incompatibilities.

components._areIncompatibleCategories: Compatibility checker preventing conflicting service combinations.

components._openOnLinux: SQLite3 library loader for Linux platform compatibility.

rules: Advanced sales data generator with 300 realistic transactions using actual database integration.
SQLite3 direct database integration with prepared statements for performance and safety.
Service category compatibility system preventing incompatible service combinations (Gel vs Acrylic, SNS vs others).
Realistic service selection: 50% single service, 30% two services, 20% three services for natural distribution.
Business hours scheduling with peak hour weighting: 30% peak morning (10 AM-1 PM), 30% peak afternoon (2 PM-4 PM).
Advanced duration modeling with realistic overruns: 70% within ±10%, 20% +10-30% over, 10% significantly over.
Database-driven data sourcing: loads actual services, employees, and customers from existing database.
Service compatibility rules based on nail salon business logic: gel/acrylic/SNS incompatibilities.
Payment method distribution reflecting real usage: 40% credit card, 30% debit card, 30% cash.
Comprehensive error handling with database validation and graceful failure recovery.
Platform-specific SQLite3 loading with Linux compatibility support.
Prepared statement usage for SQL injection prevention and performance optimization.
Previous month data generation for historical reporting and analytics testing.
Transaction integrity with proper ticket and payment record creation.
Service JSON serialization matching application data structure requirements.
Realistic pricing and duration calculations based on actual service combinations.
Employee assignment with proper technician ID tracking for service attribution.
Customer assignment using existing customer records for data consistency.
Business date tracking aligned with check-in times for accurate reporting.
Completion and payment status management for realistic transaction states.
Duration variation modeling reflecting real-world service time variability.
15-minute interval scheduling for professional appointment management.
Category-based service organization for realistic salon service groupings.
Comprehensive data validation ensuring database integrity and consistency.

components.Service: Basic data class for salon services with core pricing and duration information.

components.Employee: Simple employee data class for technician assignment.

components.Customer: Basic customer data class using existing database records.

components.main: Main function generating 300 basic sales transactions with simple randomization.

components._openOnLinux: SQLite3 library loader for Linux platform support.

rules: Basic sales data generator creating 300 simple transactions for database testing.
SQLite3 direct database integration with prepared statements for data insertion.
Simple service selection with random combinations (1-3 services per transaction).
Business hours generation: 9 AM to 8 PM with random minute/second precision.
Basic duration variation using ±50% randomization for service time modeling.
Previous month data generation for historical data testing purposes.
Random payment method selection: cash, credit_card, debit_card with equal distribution.
Database-driven data loading: services, employees, customers from existing records.
Essential validation: checks for missing services, employees, or customers before generation.
Prepared statement usage for SQL safety and performance optimization.
Service JSON serialization with basic structure for application compatibility.
Transaction completion: all generated tickets marked as 'completed' and 'paid'.
Business date alignment with check-in times for consistent reporting.
Employee assignment as both employee_id and assigned_technician_id for service tracking.
Total amount calculation based on service pricing without additional fees.
Duration calculation with random variation reflecting service time flexibility.
Ticket numbering using timestamp-based unique identifiers.
Payment record creation matching ticket amounts for financial consistency.
Database cleanup with proper statement disposal and connection closing.
Platform compatibility with Linux-specific SQLite3 library loading.
Simple error handling with database connection validation.
Basic randomization suitable for development and testing scenarios.
Straightforward implementation for quick database population needs.
